with open("newspaper02", "r",encoding="utf-8") as f:                            english = f.read()            with open("note01", "w",encoding="utf-8") as f2:        while len(english) > 0:                eng = english.split('.')[0]                 f2.write(str(eng+"\n"))                 chinese=Translator_deepl(eng)                 f2.write(str(chinese+"\n"))                 english = english[len(english.split('.')[0]) + 1:]        f2.close()  f.close()

#总结：

#fastlid库需要fasttext库的底层支持，网站下载与Python3.9匹配的fasttext.wheel。需要用pip install 在终端安装，这样才可以正常运行。

#with open(“note01”, “w”,encoding=”utf-8”) —>需要加入解码格式encoding=”utf-8”，否则报错。

#翻译函数是调用deepl的api,还可以考虑百度、有道、金山、腾讯的翻译api。不过后四个都需要注册，deepl直接使用，方便快捷。

entry.title: 星星之死
entry.content:
Star Death
星星之死

Until the early- to mid-twentieth century, scientists believed that stars generate energy by shrinking
直到二十世纪初至中期，科学家们认为恒星通过收缩产生能量
As stars contracted, it was thought, they would get hotter and hotter, giving off light in the process
人们认为，随着恒星的收缩，它们会变得越来越热，在这个过程中发出光来。
This could not be the primary way that stars shine, however
这不可能是星星闪耀的主要方式，但是 这不可能是星星发光的主要方式，但是 这不可能是星星发光的主要方式，然而 这不可能是星星发光的主要方式，但
If it were, they would scarcely last a million years, rather than the billions of years in age that we know they are
如果是这样，它们几乎不会持续一百万年，而不是我们所知的数十亿年的年龄。
We now know that stars are fueled by nuclear fusion
我们现在知道，恒星是由核聚变提供燃料的 我们现在知道，恒星是由核聚变提供燃料的。 我们现在知道，恒星是由核聚变驱动的 我们现在知道，恒星是由核聚变提供能量的
Each time fusion takes place, energy is released as a by-product
每次核聚变发生时，能量都会作为副产品释放出来
This energy, expelled into space, is what we see as starlight
这种能量，被驱逐到空间，就是我们看到的星光。
The fusion process begins when two hydrogen nuclei smash together to form a particle called the deuteron (a combination of a positive proton and a neutral neutron)
核聚变过程开始时，两个氢原子粉碎在一起，形成一个称为氘核的粒子（一个正质子和一个中性中子的组合）。
Deuterons readily combine with additional protons to form helium
氘核很容易与其他质子结合，形成氦气。
Helium, in turn, can fuse together to form heavier elements, such as carbon
氦气反过来可以融合成更重的元素，如碳。
In a typical star, merger after merger takes place until significant quantities of heavy elements are built up
在一颗典型的恒星中，发生了一次又一次的合并，直到建立起大量的重元素。

We must distinguish, at this point, between two different stellar types: Population I and Population ll, the latter being much older than the former
在这一点上，我们必须对两种不同的恒星类型加以区分。第一组和第二组，后者比前者要老得多。
These groups can also be distinguished by their locations
这些群体也可以通过其位置来区分 这些群体还可以通过其位置来区分 这些群体也可以通过他们的位置来区分 这些群体也可以根据其位置来区分
Our galaxy, the Milky Way, is shaped like a flat disk surrounding a central bulge
我们的银河系，即银河系，形状像一个扁平的圆盘，围绕着一个中心隆起。
Whereas Population I stars are found mainly in the galactic disk, Population II stars mostly reside in the central bulge of the galaxy and in the halo surrounding this bulge
I类恒星主要存在于银河系的圆盘中，而II类恒星则主要存在于银河系的中央凸起和围绕这一凸起的光环中。

Population II stars date to the early stages of the universe
第二类恒星可以追溯到宇宙的早期阶段 第二类恒星可追溯到宇宙的早期阶段 第II类恒星可以追溯到宇宙的早期阶段 第二类恒星可以追溯到宇宙早期阶段
Formed when the cosmos was filled with hydrogen and helium gases, they initially contained virtually no heavy elements
在宇宙充满氢气和氦气时形成，最初几乎不含重元素
They shine until their fusible material is exhausted
它们闪闪发光，直到它们的可熔材料用完为止 它们闪闪发光，直到它们的易熔材料用完为止 它们闪闪发光，直到它们的可熔材料用完为止。 它们闪闪发光，直到它们的易熔材料用完为止。
When Population II stars die, their material is spread out into space
当第二类恒星死亡时，它们的物质被散布到太空中。
Some of this dust is eventually incorporated into newly formed Population I stars
这些尘埃中的一部分最终被纳入新形成的I类星中
Though Population I stars consist mostly of hydrogen and helium gas, they also contain heavy elements (heavier than helium), which comprise about 1 or 2 percent of their mass
尽管I类恒星主要由氢气和氦气组成，但它们也含有重元素（比氦气重），约占其质量的1%或2%。
These heavier materials are fused from the lighter elements that the stars have collected
这些较重的材料是由恒星收集的较轻元素融合而成的。
Thus, Population I stars contain material that once belonged to stars from previous generations
因此，I类星包含的物质曾经属于前几代的恒星。
The Sun is a good example of a Population I star
太阳是I类星的一个好例子 太阳是I类星的一个很好的例子 太阳是I类星的一个很好的例子。 太阳是I类星的一个很好例子

What will happen when the Sun dies? In several billion years, our mother star will burn much brighter
太阳死亡后会发生什么？几十亿年后，我们的母星将燃烧得更加明亮
It will expend more and more of its nuclear fuel, until little is left of its original hydrogen
它将耗费越来越多的核燃料，直到它的原始氢气所剩无几。
Then, at some point in the far future, all nuclear reactions in the Sun’s center will cease
然后，在遥远的未来的某个时刻，太阳中心的所有核反应将停止。

Once the Sun passes into its “postnuclear” phase, it will separate effectively into two different regions: an inner zone and an outer zone
一旦太阳进入 “后核 “阶段，它将有效地分离成两个不同的区域：一个内区和一个外区
While no more hydrogen fuel will remain in the inner zone, there will be a small amount left in the outer zone
虽然内区不会再有氢气燃料，但外区会有少量的氢气燃料残留下来。
Rapidly, changes will begin to take place that will serve to tear the Sun apart
迅速地，变化将开始发生，这将有助于撕裂太阳。
The inner zone, its nuclear fires no longer burning, will begin to collapse under the influence of its own weight and will contract into a tiny hot core, dense and dim
内部区域，其核火不再燃烧，将在其自身重量的影响下开始崩溃，并将收缩成一个微小的热核，密集而昏暗。
An opposite fate will await the outer region, a loosely held-together ball of gas
等待外部区域的将是相反的命运，一个松散地结合在一起的气体球
A shock wave caused by the inner zone’s contraction will send ripples through the dying star, pushing the stellar exterior’s material farther and farther outward
由内区收缩引起的冲击波将在垂死的恒星中产生涟漪，将恒星外部的物质向外推得越来越远。
The outer envelope will then grow rapidly, increasing, in a short interval, hundreds of times in size
然后，外包层将迅速增长，在很短的时间内增加数百倍的大小。
As it expands, it will cool down by thousands of degrees
随着它的膨胀，它将被冷却数千度 随着它的膨胀，它将冷却数千度 随着它的膨胀，它将被冷却几千度 随着它的膨胀，它将冷却几千度
Eventually, the Sun will become a red giant star, cool and bright
最终，太阳将成为一颗红巨星，凉爽而明亮。
It will be so large that it will occupy the whole space that used to be the Earth’s orbit and so brilliant that it would be able to be seen with the naked eye thousands of light-years away
它将是如此之大，以至于它将占据整个曾经是地球轨道的空间，并且如此辉煌，以至于它将能够在数千光年之外用肉眼看到。
It will exist that way for millions of years, gradually releasing the material of its outer envelope into space
它将以这种方式存在数百万年，逐渐将其外部包层的物质释放到太空中。
Finally, nothing will be left of the gaseous exterior of the Sun; all that will remain will be the hot, white core
最后，太阳的气态外表将不复存在；剩下的将是热的、白色的核心。
The Sun will have become a white dwarf star
太阳将成为一颗白矮星 太阳将变成一颗白矮星 太阳将成为一个白矮星 太阳将成为一颗白矮星。
The core will shrink, giving off the last of its energy, and the Sun will finally die
核心将收缩，释放出最后的能量，太阳将最终死亡。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 巴西独立的成就
entry.content:
The Achievement of Brazilian Independence
巴西独立的成就

In contrast to the political anarchy, economic dislocation, and military destruction in Spanish America, Brazil’s drive toward independence from Portugal proceeded as a relatively bloodless transition between 1808 and 1822
与西班牙美洲的政治无政府状态、经济混乱和军事破坏相比，巴西从葡萄牙独立的进程在1808年至1822年间是一个相对不流血的过渡。
The idea of Brazilian independence first arose in the late eighteenth century as a Brazilian reaction to the Portuguese policy of tightening political and economic control over the colony in the interests of the mother country
巴西独立的想法最早出现在18世纪末，是巴西人对葡萄牙为了祖国的利益加强对殖民地的政治和经济控制政策的反应。
The first significant conspiracy against Portuguese rule was organized from 1788-1799 in the province of Minas Gerais, where rigid governmental control over the production and prices of gold and diamonds, as well as heavy taxes, caused much discontent
第一个反对葡萄牙统治的重大阴谋是1788-1799年在米纳斯吉拉斯省组织的，在那里，政府对黄金和钻石的生产和价格的严格控制，以及沉重的税收，引起了许多不满。
But this conspiracy never went beyond the stage of discussion and was easily discovered and crushed
但这一阴谋从未超出讨论的阶段，而是被轻易发现并粉碎了。
Other conspiracies in the late eighteenth century as well as a brief revolt in 1817 reflected the influence of republican ideas over sections of the elite and even the lower strata of urban society
十八世纪末的其他阴谋以及1817年的短暂起义反映了共和主义思想对城市社会精英阶层甚至下层的影响。
All proved abortive or were soon crushed
所有这些都被证明是失败的，或者很快就被粉碎了 所有这些都被证明是失败的，或很快就被粉碎了 所有这些都被证明是失败的，或者很快就被击垮了 所有这些都被证明是失败的，或者很快就被粉碎了。
Were it not for an accident of European history, the independence of Brazil might have been long delayed
如果不是欧洲历史上的一个意外，巴西的独立可能会被长期拖延。

The French invasion of Portugal in 1807 followed by the flight of the Portuguese court (sovereign and government officers) to Rio de Janeiro brought large benefits to Brazil
1807年法国入侵葡萄牙，随后葡萄牙宫廷（君主和政府官员）逃往里约热内卢，给巴西带来了巨大的利益。
Indeed, the transfer of the court in effect signified achievement of Brazilian independence
事实上，法院的移交实际上标志着巴西独立的实现。
The Portuguese prince and future King Joao VI opened Brazil’s ports to the trade of friendly nations, permitted the rise of local industries, and founded the Bank of Brazil
葡萄牙王子和未来的国王若昂六世向友好国家的贸易开放了巴西的港口，允许当地工业的崛起，并建立了巴西银行。
In 1815 he elevated Brazil to the legal status of a kingdom coequal with Portugal
1815年，他将巴西提升为与葡萄牙平等的王国的法律地位。
ln one sense, however, Brazil’s new status signified the substitution of one dependence for another
然而，从某种意义上说，巴西的新地位标志着一种依赖性取代了另一种依赖性。
Freed from Portuguese control, Brazil came under the economic dominance of England, which obtained major tariff concessions and other privileges by the Strangford Treaty of 1810 between Portugal and Great Britain
摆脱了葡萄牙的控制，巴西在经济上受到英国的支配，英国通过1810年葡萄牙和英国之间的《斯特朗福德条约》获得了主要的关税优惠和其他特权。
The treaty provided for the importation of British manufactures into Brazil and the export of Brazilian agricultural produce to Great Britain
该条约规定，英国的制成品可以进口到巴西，巴西的农产品可以出口到英国。
One result was an influx of cheap machine-made goods that swamped the handicrafts industry of the country
其结果之一是廉价机器制造的商品涌入，淹没了该国的手工业。

Brazilian elites took satisfaction in Brazil’s new role and the growth of educational, cultural, and economic opportunities for their class
巴西的精英们对巴西的新角色和他们阶层的教育、文化和经济机会的增长感到满意。
But the feeling was mixed with resentment toward the thousands of Portuguese courtiers (officials) and hangers-on who came with the court and who competed with Brazilians for jobs and favors
但这种感觉与对数千名葡萄牙朝臣（官员）和随宫廷而来的挂名者的怨恨交织在一起，他们与巴西人争夺工作和好处。
Thus, the change in the status of Brazil sharpened the conflict between Portuguese elites born in Brazil and elites born in Portugal and loyal to the Portuguese crown
因此，巴西地位的变化使出生在巴西的葡萄牙精英与出生在葡萄牙并忠于葡萄牙王室的精英之间的冲突更加尖锐。

The event that precipitated the break with the mother country was the revolution of 1820 in Portugal
催生与祖国决裂的事件是1820年葡萄牙的革命。
The Portuguese revolutionaries framed a liberal constitution for the kingdom, but they were conservative or reactionary in relation to Brazil
葡萄牙革命者为王国制定了一部自由主义的宪法，但他们在与巴西的关系上是保守或反动的。
They demanded the immediate return of King Joao to Lisbon, an end to the system of dual monarchy that he had devised, and the restoration of the Portuguese commercial monopoly
他们要求若昂国王立即返回里斯本，结束他所设计的双重君主制，并恢复葡萄牙的商业垄断。
Timid and vacillating, King Joao did not know which way to turn
胆怯和摇摆不定，若昂国王不知道该往哪个方向走。
Under the pressure of his courtiers, who hungered to return to Portugal and their lost estates, he finally approved the new constitution and sailed for Portugal
在渴望返回葡萄牙和他们失去的财产的朝臣们的压力下，他最终批准了新宪法，并驶向了葡萄牙
He left behind him, however, his son and heir, Pedro, and in a private letter advised him that in the event the Brazilians should demand independence, he should assume leadership of the movement and set the crown of Brazil on his head
然而，他留下了他的儿子和继承人佩德罗，并在一封私人信件中建议他，如果巴西人要求独立，他应该承担起运动的领导权，并将巴西的王冠戴在自己头上。

Soon it became clear that the Portuguese parliament intended to set the clock back by abrogating all the liberties and concessions won by Brazil since 1808
很快，葡萄牙议会显然打算废除巴西自1808年以来赢得的所有自由和特许权，从而使时间倒流。
One of its decrees insisted on the immediate return of Pedro from Brazil
它的一项法令坚持要求佩德罗立即从巴西返回。
The pace of events moved more rapidly in 1822
1822年，事件的发展步伐更加迅速 1822年，事件的发展速度更快 1822年，事件的发展速度更加迅速 1822年，事件的进展更加迅速
On January 9, urged on by Brazilian advisers who perceived a golden opportunity to make an orderly transition to independence without the intervention of the masses, Pedro refused an order from the parliament to return to Portugal, saying famously, “l remain
1月9日，在巴西顾问的敦促下，佩德罗拒绝了议会发出的返回葡萄牙的命令，他说了一句著名的话：”我仍然是
“ On September 7, regarded by all Brazilians as Independence Day, he issued the even more celebrated proclamation, “Independence or death!” In December 1822, having overcome slight resistance by Portuguese troops, Dom Pedro was formally proclaimed constitutional Emperor of Brazil
“ 9月7日，被所有巴西人视为独立日，他发布了更为著名的宣言：”不独立就得死！” 1822年12月，在克服了葡萄牙军队的轻微抵抗后，多姆-佩德罗被正式宣布为巴西的宪政皇帝。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 美国的铁路
entry.content:
American Railroads
美国的铁路

In the United States, railroads spearheaded the second phase of the transportation revolution by overtaking the previous importance of canals
在美国，铁路引领了运输革命的第二阶段，超越了以前运河的重要性。
The mid-1800s saw a great expansion of American railroads
19世纪中期，美国铁路大举扩张 19世纪中期，美国的铁路得到了极大的扩展 19世纪中期，美国的铁路大举扩张 19世纪中叶，美国铁路大举扩张
The major cities east of the Mississippi River were linked by a spiderweb of railroad tracks
密西西比河以东的主要城市由蜘蛛网般的铁轨连接起来
Chicago’s growth illustrates the impact of these rail links
芝加哥的增长说明了这些铁路连接的影响 芝加哥的增长说明了这些铁路链接的影响 芝加哥的发展说明了这些铁路连接的影响 芝加哥的增长表明了这些铁路连接的影响
In 1849 Chicago was a village of a few hundred people with virtually no rail service
1849年，芝加哥是一个只有几百人的村庄，几乎没有铁路服务。
By 1860 it had become a city of 100,000, served by eleven railroads
到1860年，它已成为一个拥有10万人口的城市，有11条铁路提供服务
Farmers to the north and west of Chicago no longer had to ship their grain, livestock, and dairy products down the Mississippi River to New Orleans; they could now ship their products directly east
芝加哥北部和西部的农民不再需要将他们的谷物、牲畜和乳制品沿密西西比河运到新奥尔良；他们现在可以直接向东运输他们的产品。
Chicago supplanted New Orleans as the interior of America’s main commercial hub
芝加哥取代新奥尔良成为美国内陆的主要商业中心

The east-west rail lines stimulated the settlement and agricultural development of the Midwest
东西向的铁路线刺激了中西部地区的定居和农业发展。
By 1860 Illinois, Indiana, and Wisconsin had replaced Ohio, Pennsylvania, and New York as the leading wheat-growing states
到1860年，伊利诺伊州、印第安纳州和威斯康星州已取代俄亥俄州、宾夕法尼亚州和纽约州成为主要的小麦种植州。
Enabling farmers to speed their products to the East, railroads increased the value of farmland and promoted additional settlement
铁路使农民能够将他们的产品快速运往东部，提高了农田的价值，促进了更多的定居。
In turn, population growth in agricultural areas triggered industrial development in cities such as Chicago, Davenport (Iowa), and Minneapolis, for the new settlers needed lumber for fences and houses and mills to grind wheat into flour
反过来，农业地区的人口增长引发了芝加哥、达文波特（爱荷华州）和明尼阿波利斯等城市的工业发展，因为新定居者需要木材来建造篱笆和房屋，需要磨坊来将小麦磨成面粉。

Railroads also propelled the growth of small towns along their routes
铁路也推动了沿线小城镇的发展。
The Illinois Central Railroad, which had more track than any other railroad in 1855, made money not only from its traffic but also from real estate speculation
伊利诺伊州中央铁路公司在1855年拥有比任何其他铁路更多的轨道，它不仅从交通中赚钱，而且还从房地产投机中赚钱。
Purchasing land for stations along its path, the Illinois Central then laid out towns around the stations
伊利诺伊州中央银行购买了沿途车站的土地，然后在车站周围布置了城镇。
The selection of Manteno, Illinois, as a stop of the Illinois Central, for example, transformed the site from a crossroads without a single house in 1854 into a bustling town of nearly a thousand in 1860, replete with hotels, lumberyards, grain elevators, and gristmills
例如，伊利诺伊州曼特诺市被选为伊利诺伊州中央银行的一个站点，使该地从1854年没有一栋房子的十字路口变成了1860年有近千人的繁华小镇，充满了旅馆、伐木场、谷物升降机和磨坊。
By the Civil War (1861-1865), few thought of the railroad-linked Midwest as a frontier region or viewed its inhabitants as pioneers
到了内战时期（1861-1865年），很少有人认为与铁路相连的中西部地区是一个边疆地区，也很少有人将其居民视为先驱者。

As the nation’s first big business, the railroads transformed the conduct of business
作为国家的第一个大企业，铁路改变了商业行为。
During the early 1830s, railroads, like canals, depended on financial aid from state governments
在19世纪30年代初，铁路和运河一样，依赖于州政府的财政援助。
With the onset of economic depression in the late 1830s, however, state governments scrapped overly ambitious railroad projects
然而，随着19世纪30年代末经济萧条的出现，各州政府取消了过于雄心勃勃的铁路项目。
Convinced that railroads burdened them with high taxes and blasted hopes, voters turned against state aid, and in the early 1840s, several states amended their constitutions to bar state funding for railroads and canals
选民们确信，铁路给他们带来了高额的税收，并使他们的希望破灭，因此他们反对国家的援助。
The federal government took up some of the slack, but federal aid did not provide a major stimulus to railroads before 1860
联邦政府承担了部分责任，但在1860年之前，联邦援助并没有给铁路带来重大刺激。
Rather, part of the burden of finance passed to city and county governments in agricultural areas that wanted to attract railroads
相反，部分财政负担转给了希望吸引铁路的农业地区的市县政府。
Such municipal governments, for example, often gave railroads rights-of-way, grants of land for stations, and public funds
例如，这些市政府往往给铁路以路权，为车站批地，并提供公共资金。

The dramatic expansion of the railroad network in the 1850s, however, strained the financing capacity of local governments and required a turn toward private investment, which had never been absent from the picture
然而，19世纪50年代铁路网的急剧扩张，使地方政府的融资能力紧张，需要转向私人投资，而私人投资从未缺席过。
Well aware of the economic benefits of railroads, individuals living near them had long purchased railroad stock issued by governments and had directly bought stock in railroads, often paying by contributing their labor to building the railroads
由于深知铁路的经济效益，居住在铁路附近的个人长期以来一直购买政府发行的铁路股票，并直接购买铁路的股票，往往通过贡献自己的劳动来建造铁路。
But the large railroads of the 1850s needed more capital than such small investors could generate
但19世纪50年代的大型铁路需要更多的资本，而不是这些小投资者能够产生的。
Gradually, the center of railroad financing shifted to New York City, and in fact, it was the railroad boom of the 1850s that helped make Wall Street in New York City the nation’s greatest capital market
渐渐地，铁路融资的中心转移到了纽约市，事实上，正是19世纪50年代的铁路热潮帮助纽约市的华尔街成为全国最大的资本市场。
The stocks of all the leading railroads were traded on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange during the 1850s
19世纪50年代，所有主要铁路公司的股票都在纽约证券交易所的大厅里进行交易。
In addition, the growth of railroads turned New York City into the center of modern investment firms
此外，铁路的发展使纽约市成为现代投资公司的中心。
The investment firms evaluated the stock of railroads in the smaller American cities and then found purchasers for these stocks in New York City, Philadelphia, Paris, London, Amsterdam, and Hamburg
这些投资公司评估了美国小城市的铁路股票，然后在纽约市、费城、巴黎、伦敦、阿姆斯特丹和汉堡为这些股票寻找购买者。
Controlling the flow of funds to railroads, the investment bankers began to exert influence over the railroads’ internal affairs by supervising administrative reorganizations in times of trouble
控制资金流向铁路，投资银行家开始对铁路的内部事务施加影响，在困难时期监督行政重组。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 十九世纪欧洲的人口增长情况
entry.content:
Population Growth in Nineteenth-Century Europe
十九世纪欧洲的人口增长情况

Because of industrialization, but also because of a vast increase in agricultural output without which industrialization would have been impossible, Western Europeans by the latter half of the nineteenth century enjoyed higher standards of living and longer, healthier lives than most of the world’s peoples
由于工业化，同时也由于农业产出的大量增加，没有农业产出就不可能实现工业化，到19世纪后半期，西欧人比世界上大多数人享有更高的生活水平和更长、更健康的生命。
In Europe as a whole, the population rose from 188 million in 1800 to 400 million in 1900
在整个欧洲，人口从1800年的1.88亿上升到1900年的4亿。
By 1900, virtually every area of Europe had contributed to the tremendous surge of population, but each major region was at a different stage of demographic change
到1900年，欧洲几乎每个地区都为人口的巨大激增做出了贡献，但每个主要地区都处于人口变化的不同阶段。

Improvements in the food supply continued trends that had started in the late seventeenth century
食品供应的改善延续了17世纪末开始的趋势
New lands were put under cultivation, while the use of crops of American origin, particularly the potato, continued to expand
新的土地被投入耕种，而源自美国的作物，特别是马铃薯的使用继续扩大。
Setbacks did occur
确实发生了挫折 确实出现了挫折 挫折确实发生了 确实有挫折发生
Regional agricultural failures were the most common cause of economic recessions until 1850, and they could lead to localized famine as well
在1850年之前，地区性的农业失败是经济衰退最常见的原因，它们也可能导致局部的饥荒。
A major potato blight (disease) in 1846-1847 led to the deaths of at least one million persons in Ireland and the emigration of another million, and Ireland never recovered the population levels the potato had sustained to that point
1846-1847年的一次重大的马铃薯枯萎病（疾病）导致爱尔兰至少有100万人死亡，另有100万人移居国外，爱尔兰再也没有恢复到马铃薯到那时所维持的人口水平
Bad grain harvests at the same time led to increased hardship throughout much of Europe
同时，粮食歉收导致整个欧洲大部分地区的困苦加剧

After 1850, however, the expansion of foods more regularly kept pace with population growth, though the poorer classes remained malnourished
然而，在1850年之后，食品的扩张更经常地与人口增长保持同步，尽管较贫穷的阶层仍然营养不良。
Two developments were crucial
有两个发展是至关重要的 有两项发展是至关重要的 有两个发展是关键的 有两个事态发展是至关重要的
First, the application of science and new technology to agriculture increased
首先，科学和新技术在农业中的应用增加了
Led by German universities, increasing research was devoted to improving seeds, developing chemical fertilizers, and advancing livestock
在德国大学的带领下，越来越多的研究致力于改进种子、开发化肥和推进畜牧业的发展。
After 1861, with the development of land-grant universities in the United States that had huge agricultural programs, American crop-production research added to this mix
1861年后，随着美国拥有庞大农业项目的赠地大学的发展，美国的作物生产研究也加入了这一组合。
Mechanization included the use of horse-drawn harvesters and seed drills, many developed initially in the United States
机械化包括使用马拉的收割机和播种机，其中许多最初是在美国开发的。
It also included mechanical cream separators and other food-processing devices that improved supply
它还包括机械奶油分离器和其他改善供应的食品加工装置。

The second development involved industrially based transportation
第二个发展涉及基于工业的运输
With trains and steam shipping, it became possible to move foods to needy regions within Western Europe quickly
有了火车和蒸汽船，就有可能将食物迅速运送到西欧的贫困地区。
Famine (as opposed to malnutrition) became a thing of the past
饥荒（相对于营养不良）成为过去的事情
Many Western European countries, headed by Britain, began also to import increasing amounts of food, not only from Eastern Europe, a traditional source, but also from the Americas, Australia, and New Zealand
以英国为首的许多西欧国家也开始进口越来越多的食品，不仅从东欧这个传统来源，而且还从美洲、澳大利亚和新西兰进口。
Steam shipping, which improved speed and capacity, as well as new procedures for canning and refrigerating foods (particularly after 1870), was fundamental to these developments
蒸汽运输提高了速度和容量，以及罐装和冷藏食品的新程序（特别是在1870年之后），是这些发展的基础。

Europe’s population growth included one additional innovation by the nineteenth century: it combined with rapid urbanization
到19世纪，欧洲的人口增长还包括一项创新：它与快速的城市化相结合
More and more Western Europeans moved from countryside to city, and big cities grew most rapidly of all
越来越多的西欧人从乡村迁往城市，而大城市的发展最为迅速
By 1850, over half of all the people in England lived in cities, a first in human history
到1850年，英国一半以上的人生活在城市，这是人类历史上的第一次。
In one sense, this pattern seems inevitable growing numbers of people pressed available resources on the land, even when farmwork was combined with a bit of manufacturing, so people crowded into cities seeking work or other resources
从某种意义上说，这种模式似乎是不可避免的，越来越多的人压榨着土地上的可用资源，即使是在农业劳动与一些制造业相结合的情况下，人们也会挤进城市寻找工作或其他资源。
Traditionally, however, death rates in cities surpassed those in the countryside by a large margin; cities had maintained population only through steady in-migration
然而，传统上，城市的死亡率远远超过了农村的死亡率；城市只能通过稳定的移民来维持人口。
Thus rapid urbanization should have reduced overall population growth, but by the middle of the nineteenth century this was no longer the case
因此，快速的城市化应该减少总的人口增长，但到了19世纪中期，情况就不再是这样了
Urban death rates remained high, particularly in the lower-class slums, but they began to decline rapidly
城市的死亡率仍然很高，特别是在下层贫民窟，但它们开始迅速下降

The greater reliability of food supplies was a factor in the decline of urban death rates
食物供应更加可靠是城市死亡率下降的一个因素
Even more important were the gains in urban sanitation, as well as measures such as inspection of housing
更重要的是在城市卫生方面取得的成果，以及对住房进行检查等措施。
Reformers, including enlightened doctors, began to study the causes of high death rates and to urge remediation
改革者，包括开明的医生，开始研究高死亡率的原因，并敦促进行补救。
Even before the discovery of germs, beliefs that disease spread by “miasmas” (noxious forms of bad air) prompted attention to sewers and open garbage; Edwin Chadwick led an exemplary urban crusade for underground sewers in England in the 1830s
甚至在发现病菌之前，认为疾病通过 “瘴气”（有毒的不良空气形式）传播的信念就促使人们关注下水道和露天垃圾；埃德温-查德威克在19世纪30年代领导了一场关于英国地下下水道的模范城市运动。
Gradually, public health provisions began to cut into customary urban mortality rates
渐渐地，公共卫生规定开始削减城市的习惯死亡率
By 1900, in some parts of Western Europe life expectancy in the cities began to surpass that of the rural areas
到1900年，在西欧的一些地区，城市的预期寿命开始超过农村地区的预期寿命。
Industrial societies had figured out ways to combine large and growing cities with population growth, a development that would soon spread to other parts of the world
工业社会已经想出了将大型和不断增长的城市与人口增长相结合的方法，这一发展很快就会蔓延到世界其他地区。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 金星和地球上的表面液体
entry.content:
Surface Fluids on Venus and Earth
金星和地球上的表面液体

A fluid is a substance, such as a liquid or gas, in which the component particles (usually molecules) can move past one another
流体是一种物质，如液体或气体，其中的组成颗粒（通常是分子）可以相互移动。
Fluids flow easily and conform to the shape of their containers
液体容易流动并符合其容器的形状
The geologic processes related to the movement of fluids on a planet’s surface can completely resurface a planet many times
与行星表面流体运动有关的地质过程可以使一个行星完全重新浮出水面许多次
These processes derive their energy from the Sun and the gravitational forces of the planet itself
这些过程从太阳和行星本身的引力中获得能量
As these fluids interact with surface materials, they move particles about or react chemically with them to modify or produce materials
当这些液体与表面材料相互作用时，它们会使颗粒移动或与它们发生化学反应，从而改变或产生材料。
On a solid planet with a hydrosphere and an atmosphere, only a tiny fraction of the planetary mass flows as surface fluids
在一个有水圈和大气的固体行星上，只有极小部分的行星质量以表面流体的形式流动。
Yet the movements of these fluids can drastically alter a planet
然而，这些流体的运动可以极大地改变一个星球。
Consider Venus and Earth, both terrestrial planets with atmospheres
考虑到金星和地球，这两颗陆地行星都有大气层

Venus and Earth are commonly regarded as twin planets but not identical twins
金星和地球通常被认为是双胞胎行星，但不是同卵双胞胎。
They are about the same size, are composed of roughly the same mix of materials, and may have been comparably endowed at their beginning with carbon dioxide and water
它们的大小差不多，由大致相同的材料组合组成，并且在开始时可能具有相当的二氧化碳和水。
However, the twins evolved differently largely because of differences in their distance from the Sun
然而，这对双胞胎的进化方式不同，主要是因为它们与太阳的距离不同。
With a significant amount of internal heat, Venus may continue to be geologically active with volcanoes, rifting, and folding
由于有大量的内部热量，金星可能会继续在地质上活跃，出现火山、断裂和褶皱等现象。
However, it lacks any sign of a hydrologic system (water circulation and distribution): there are no streams, lakes oceans or glaciers
然而，它缺乏任何水文系统（水循环和分配）的迹象：没有溪流、湖泊、海洋或冰川。
Space probes suggest that Venus may have started with as much water as Earth, but it was unable to keep its water in liquid form
空间探测器表明，金星开始时可能有和地球一样多的水，但它无法将其水保持在液态形式。
Because Venus receives more heat from the Sun, water released from the interior evaporated and rose to the upper atmosphere where the Sun’s ultraviolet rays broke the molecules apart
由于金星从太阳接收到更多的热量，从内部释放的水蒸发并上升到大气层上部，在那里太阳的紫外线将分子分解开来
Much of the freed hydrogen escaped into space, and Venus lost its water
大部分被释放的氢气逃到了太空中，而金星失去了它的水。
Without water, Venus became less and less like Earth and kept an atmosphere filled with carbon dioxide
没有水，金星变得越来越不像地球，并保持着充满二氧化碳的大气层
The carbon dioxide acts as a blanket, creating an intense greenhouse effect and driving surface temperatures high enough to melt lead and to prohibit the formation of carbonate minerals
二氧化碳就像一张毯子，产生强烈的温室效应，使表面温度高到足以融化铅，并禁止碳酸盐矿物的形成。
Volcanoes continually vented more carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
火山不断地将更多的二氧化碳排放到大气中
On Earth, liquid water removes carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and combines it with calcium, from rock weathering, to form carbonate sedimentary rocks
在地球上，液态水从大气中带走二氧化碳，并与岩石风化产生的钙结合，形成碳酸盐沉积岩。
Without liquid water to remove carbon from the atmosphere, the level of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere of Venus remains high
如果没有液态水来清除大气中的碳，金星大气中的二氧化碳水平仍然很高

Like Venus, Earth is large enough to be geologically active and for its gravitational field to hold an atmosphere
像金星一样，地球大到足以让地质活动活跃，其引力场足以容纳大气。
Unlike Venus, it is just the right distance from the Sun so that temperature ranges allow water to exist as a liquid, a solid, and a gas
与金星不同，它与太阳的距离恰到好处，因此温度范围允许水以液体、固体和气体的形式存在。
Water is thus extremely mobile and moves rapidly over the planet in a continuous hydrologic cycle
因此，水具有极强的流动性，在连续的水文循环中在地球上迅速移动
Heated by the Sun, the water moves in great cycles from the oceans to the atmosphere, over the landscape in river systems, and ultimately back to the oceans
在太阳的加热下，水在巨大的循环中从海洋流向大气层，在河流系统中穿过景观，并最终回到海洋中。
As a result, Earth’s surface has been continually changed and eroded into delicate systems of river valleys - a remarkable contrast to the surfaces of other planetary bodies where impact craters dominate
因此，地球的表面被不断地改变，并被侵蚀成精致的河谷系统–这与其他行星体的表面形成了显著的对比，这些行星体的撞击坑占主导地位。
Few areas on Earth have been untouched by flowing water
地球上很少有地区没有被流动的水触动过 地球上很少有地区没有被流动的水影响过 地球上很少有地区没有被流水冲刷过 地球上很少有地区没有被流动的水所影响
As a result, river valleys are the dominant feature of its landscape
因此，河谷是其景观的主要特征。
Similarly, wind action has scoured fine particles away from large areas, depositing them elsewhere as vast sand seas dominated by dunes or in sheets of loess (fine-grained soil deposits)
同样，风的作用将细小的颗粒从大片地区吹走，在其他地方沉积成以沙丘为主的巨大沙海或成片的黄土（细粒土壤沉积）。
These fluid movements are caused by gravity flow systems energized by heat from the Sun
这些流体运动是由太阳的热量激发的重力流系统引起的
Other geologic changes occur when the gases in the atmosphere or water react with rocks at the surface to form new chemical compounds with different properties
当大气中的气体或水与地表的岩石发生反应，形成具有不同性质的新化合物时，就会发生其他地质变化。
An important example of this process was the removal of most of Earths carbon dioxide from its atmosphere to form carbonate rocks
这一过程的一个重要例子是将地球上的大部分二氧化碳从大气中移除，形成碳酸盐岩石。
However, if Earth were a little closer to the Sun, its oceans would evaporate; if it were farther from the Sun, the oceans would freeze solid
然而，如果地球离太阳再近一点，它的海洋就会蒸发；如果它离太阳再远一点，海洋就会冻结成固体。
Because liquid water was present, self-replicating molecules of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen developed life early in Earth’s history and have radically modified its surface, blanketing huge parts of the continents with greenery
由于液态水的存在，碳、氢和氧的自我复制分子在地球历史的早期发展了生命，并从根本上改变了地球的表面，使大陆的大部分地区被绿色植物所覆盖。
Life thrives on this planet, and it helped create the planet’s oxygen- and nitrogen-rich atmosphere and moderate temperatures
生命在这个星球上茁壮成长，它帮助创造了这个星球上富含氧气和氮气的大气和适度的温度

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 孟菲斯：联合埃及的第一个首都
entry.content:
Memphis: United Egypt’s First Capital
孟菲斯：联合埃及的第一个首都

The city of Memphis, located on the Nile near the modern city of Cairo, was founded around 3100 B
孟菲斯城位于尼罗河上，靠近现代城市开罗，大约在公元前3100年建立。
C
C
as the first capital of a recently united Egypt
作为最近统一的埃及的第一个首都 作为刚刚统一的埃及的第一个首都 作为刚统一的埃及的第一个首都 作为最近统一的埃及的第一座首都
The choice of Memphis by Egypt’s first kings reflects the site’s strategic importance
埃及的第一个国王选择孟菲斯，反映了该地的战略重要性
First, and most obvious, the apex of the Nile River delta was a politically opportune location for the state’s administrative center, standing between the united lands of Upper and Lower Egypt and offering ready access to both parts of the country
首先，也是最明显的一点，尼罗河三角洲的顶点是国家行政中心的一个政治上的有利位置，它位于上埃及和下埃及的统一土地之间，可以随时进入该国的两个地区。
The older predynastic (pre-3100 B
较早的前王朝时期（公元前3100年 较早的前王朝时期（公元前3100年以前 较早的前王朝（公元前3100年 较早的前王朝（公元前3100年以前
C
C
) centers of power, This and Hierakonpolis, were too remote from the vast expanse of the delta, which had been incorporated into the unified state
权力中心This和Hierakonpolis距离广阔的三角洲太过遥远，而三角洲已经被纳入统一的国家。
Only a city within easy reach of both the Nile valley to the south and the more spread out, difficult terrain to the north could provide the necessary political control that the rulers of early dynastic Egypt (roughly 3000-2600 B
只有在南边的尼罗河流域和北边更分散、更困难的地形中都能方便地找到一个城市，才能提供必要的政治控制，使埃及早期王朝的统治者（大约在公元前3000-2600年）能够实现。
C
C
) required
) 要求 ) 需要 )要求 ) 所需的

The region of Memphis must have also served as an important node for transport and communications, even before the unification of Egypt
孟菲斯地区肯定也是一个重要的交通和通信节点，甚至在埃及统一之前也是如此。
The region probably acted as a conduit for much, if not all, of the river-based trade between northern and southern Egypt
该地区可能是埃及北部和南部之间大部分（如果不是全部）基于河流的贸易的通道。
Moreover, commodities (such as wine, precious oils, and metals) imported from the Near East by the royal courts of predynastic Upper Egypt would have been channeled through the Memphis region on their way south
此外，上古时期上埃及王室从近东进口的商品（如葡萄酒、贵重油料和金属），在南下的路上会经过孟菲斯地区。
In short, therefore, the site of Memphis offered the rulers of the Early Dynastic Period an ideal location for controlling internal trade within their realm, an essential requirement for a state-directed economy that depended on the movement of goods
因此，简而言之，孟菲斯为早期王朝时期的统治者提供了一个控制其境内贸易的理想地点，这对于依赖货物流动的国家指导型经济来说是一个基本要求。

Equally important for the national administration was the ability to control communications within Egypt
对国家行政当局来说，同样重要的是控制埃及境内的通信的能力。
The Nile provided the easiest and quickest artery of communication and the national capital was, again, ideally located in this respect
尼罗河提供了最方便快捷的交通动脉，而国家首都在这方面的位置也非常理想。
Recent geological surveys of the Memphis region have revealed much about its topography in ancient times
最近对孟菲斯地区的地质调查揭示了其古代地形的许多情况
It appears that the location of Memphis may have been even more advantageous for controlling trade, transport, and communications than was previously appreciated
看来，孟菲斯的位置对于控制贸易、运输和通信来说，可能比以前所了解的更加有利。
Surveys and drill cores have shown that the level of the Nile floodplain has steadily risen over the last five millenniums
勘测和钻芯显示，尼罗河洪泛区的水平在过去五千年中一直稳步上升
When the floodplain was much lower, as it would have been in predynastic and early dynastic times, the outwash fans (fan-shaped deposits of sediments) of various wadis (stream-beds or channels that carry water only during rainy periods) would have been much more prominent features on the east bank
当洪泛区低得多时，就像在王朝前和王朝早期那样，各种瓦地（只在雨季运水的河床或渠道）的冲刷扇（扇形沉积物）会成为东岸更突出的特征。
The fan associated with the Wadi Hof extended a significant way into the Nile floodplain, forming a constriction in the vicinity of Memphis
与瓦迪-霍夫有关的扇形物延伸到尼罗河洪泛区，在孟菲斯附近形成了一个限制。
The valley may have narrowed at this point to a mere three kilometers, making it the ideal place for controlling river traffic
山谷在这一点上可能已经缩小到只有三公里，使其成为控制河流交通的理想场所

Furthermore, the Memphis region seems to have been favorably located for the control not only of river-based trade but also of desert trade routes
此外，孟菲斯地区似乎处于有利的位置，不仅可以控制基于河流的贸易，而且可以控制沙漠贸易路线。
The two outwash fans in the area gave access to the extensive wadi systems of the eastern desert
该地区的两个冲积扇使人们可以进入东部沙漠的广泛的瓦迪系统。
In predynastic times, the Wadi Digla may have served as a trade route between the Memphis region and the Near East, to judge from the unusual concentration of foreign artifacts found in the predynastic settlement of Maadi
在公元前时代，瓦迪迪格拉可能是孟菲斯地区和近东之间的一条贸易路线，这可以从马迪的公元前定居点中发现的不寻常的外国文物中判断出来。
Access to, and control of, trade routes between Egypt and the Near East seems to have been a preoccupation of Egypt’s rulers during the period of state formation
进入并控制埃及和近东之间的贸易路线，似乎是埃及统治者在国家形成时期的一个首要任务。
The desire to monopolize foreign trade may have been one of the primary factors behind the political unification of Egypt
垄断对外贸易的愿望可能是埃及政治统一的主要因素之一。
The foundation of the national capital at the junction of an important trade route with the Nile valley is not likely to have been accidental
国家首都建立在与尼罗河流域的重要贸易路线的交界处，这不可能是偶然的。
Moreover, the Wadis Hof and Digla provided the Memphis region with accessible desert pasturage
此外，Wadis Hof和Digla为孟菲斯地区提供了方便的沙漠牧草
As was the case with the cities of Hierakonpolis and Elkab, the combination within the same area of both desert pasturage and alluvial arable land (land suitable for growing crops) was a particularly attractive one for early settlement; this combination no doubt contributed to the prosperity of the Memphis region from early predynastic times
正如希拉孔波利斯和艾尔卡布城市的情况一样，在同一地区同时拥有沙漠牧场和冲积耕地（适合种植农作物的土地）对早期定居者来说是特别有吸引力的；这种组合无疑有助于孟菲斯地区从王朝前早期开始的繁荣。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 纳图菲亚人的文化
entry.content:
Natufian Culture
纳图菲亚人的文化

In the archaeological record of the Natufian period, from about 12,500 to 10,200 years ago, in the part of the Middle East known as the Levant - roughly east of the Mediterranean and north of the Arabian Peninsula - we see clear evidence of agricultural origins
在纳图菲亚时期的考古记录中，从大约12500年到10200年前，在被称为黎凡特的中东地区–大致在地中海以东和阿拉伯半岛以北–我们看到农业起源的明确证据
The stone tools of the Natufians included many sickle-shaped cutting blades that show a pattern of wear characteristic of cereal harvesting
纳图菲人的石器包括许多镰刀状的切割刀片，显示出谷物收割时特有的磨损模式。
Also, querns (hand mills) and other stone tools used for processing grain occur in abundance at Natufian sites, and many such tools show signs of long, intensive use
此外，在纳图菲亚遗址中还出现了大量用于加工谷物的querns（手磨）和其他石制工具，而且许多此类工具显示出长期密集使用的迹象。
Along with the sickle blades are many grinding stones, primarily mortars and pestles of limestone or basalt
与镰刀刃一起的还有许多磨石，主要是石灰石或玄武岩的臼和杵。
There is also evidence that these heavy grinding stones were transported over long distances, more than 30 kilometers in some cases, and this is not something known to have been done by people of preceding periods
还有证据表明，这些沉重的磨石被长途运输，在某些情况下超过30公里，而这并不是已知的前几个时期的人们所做的事情。
Fishhooks and weights for sinking fishing nets attest to the growing importance of fish in the diet in some areas
鱼钩和下沉渔网的砝码证明了鱼类在一些地区的饮食中越来越重要。
Stone vessels indicate an increased need for containers, but there is no evidence of Natufian clay working or pottery
石器表明对容器的需求增加，但没有证据表明纳图菲亚时代的粘土加工或制陶。
Studies of the teeth of Natufians also strongly suggest that these people specialized in collecting cereals and may have been cultivating them and in the process of domesticating them, but they were also still hunter-foragers who intensively hunted gazelle and deer in more lush areas and wild goats and equids in more arid zones
对纳图菲亚人牙齿的研究也强烈表明，这些人专门收集谷物，并可能一直在栽培谷物，而且正在驯化谷物，但他们也仍然是狩猎者，在较为茂盛的地区密集地猎取羚羊和鹿，在较为干旱的地区猎取野山羊和马。

The Natufians had a different settlement pattern from that of their predecessors
纳图菲人的定居模式与他们的前辈不同
Some of their base camps were far larger (over 1,000 square meters) than any of those belonging to earlier periods, and they may have lived in some of these camps for half the year or even more
他们的一些大本营比早期的任何一个大本营都要大得多（超过1000平方米），而且他们可能在其中一些大本营中生活了半年甚至更长时间。
In some of the camps, people made foundations and other architectural elements out of limestone blocks
在一些营地，人们用石灰石块制作地基和其他建筑元素。
Trade in shell, obsidian, and other commodities seems to have been on the rise, and anthropologists suspect that the exchange of perishables (such as skins, foodstuffs) and salt was also on the increase
贝壳、黑曜石和其他商品的贸易似乎一直在增加，人类学家怀疑易腐物品（如皮毛、食品）和盐的交换也在增加。
With the growing importance of wild cereals in the diet, salt probably became for the first time a near necessity: people who eat a lot of meat get many essential salts from this diet, but diets based on cereals can be deficient in salts
随着野生谷物在饮食中的重要性日益增加，盐可能第一次成为一种近乎必需品：吃很多肉的人从这种饮食中获得许多必需的盐，但以谷物为主的饮食可能缺乏盐。
Salt was probably also important as a food preservative in early villages
在早期的村庄，盐可能也是重要的食品防腐剂。

As always, there is more to a major cultural change than simply a shift in economics
与往常一样，重大的文化变革不仅仅是经济上的转变，还有更多的内容。
The Natufians made (and presumably wore) beads and pendants in many materials, including gemstones and marine shells that had to be imported, and it is possible that this ornamentation actually reflects a growing sense of ethnic identity and perhaps some differences in personal and group status
纳图菲人用许多材料制作（并可能佩戴）珠子和吊坠，包括必须进口的宝石和海洋贝壳，可能这种装饰品实际上反映了日益增长的种族认同感，也许还有一些个人和团体地位的差异
Cleverly carved figurines of animals, women, and other subjects occur in many sites, and Natufian period cave paintings have been found in Anatolia, Syria, and Iran
在许多遗址中出现了巧妙的动物、妇女和其他主题的雕像，在安纳托利亚、叙利亚和伊朗也发现了纳图菲亚时期的洞穴壁画。
More than 400 Natufian burials have been found, most of them simple graves set in house floors
已经发现了400多座纳图菲人的墓葬，其中大部分是设置在房屋地板上的简单坟墓。
As archaeologist Belfer-Cohen notes, these burials may reflect an ancestor cult and a growing sense of community emotional ties and attachment to a particular place, and toward the end of the Natufian period, people in this area were making a strict separation between living quarters and burial grounds
正如考古学家Belfer-Cohen所指出的，这些墓葬可能反映了对祖先的崇拜和日益增长的社区情感纽带和对特定地方的依恋，在Natufian时期的末期，这个地区的人们正在将生活区和墓地严格分开。
In contrast with the Pleistocene cultures of the Levant, Natufian culture appears to have experienced considerable social change
与黎凡特的更新世文化相比，纳图菲亚文化似乎经历了相当大的社会变化

The question of why the Natufians differed from their predecessors in these and other ways and why they made these first steps toward farming as a way of life remains unclear
为什么纳图菲人在这些方面和其他方面与他们的前辈不同，以及为什么他们向农耕这一生活方式迈出了第一步，这个问题仍然不清楚。
There were climate changes, of course, and growing aridity and rising population densities may have forced them to intensify the exploitation of cereals, which in turn might have stimulated the development of sickles and other tools and the permanent communities that make agriculture efficient
当然，还有气候变化，日益干旱和人口密度的增加可能迫使他们加强对谷物的开发，这反过来可能刺激了镰刀和其他工具的发展，以及使农业高效的永久社区的发展。
But precisely how these factors interacted with others at play is poorly understood
但确切地说，这些因素如何与其他因素相互作用，人们对此了解甚少。

Early Food Production in Sub-Saharan Africa
撒哈拉以南非洲的早期粮食生产 撒哈拉以南非洲地区的早期粮食生产 撒哈拉以南非洲的早期食品生产 撒哈拉以南非洲的早期食物生产

At the end of the Pleistocene (around 10,000 B
在更新世末期（大约公元前10,000年）。 在更新世末期（大约公元前10,000年 在更新世末期（大约在公元前10,000年
C
C
), the technologies of food production may have already been employed on the fringes of the rain forests of western and central Africa, where the common use of such root plants as the African yam led people to recognize the advantages of growing their own food
在非洲西部和中部的雨林边缘，可能已经采用了粮食生产技术，那里普遍使用非洲山药等根茎类植物，使人们认识到种植自己的食物的好处。
The yam can easily be resprouted if the top is replanted
如果重新种植，山药很容易重新发芽。 如果重新种植山药，山药很容易重新发芽 如果重新种植，山药很容易重新发芽
This primitive form of “vegeculture” (cultivation of root and tree crops) may have been the economic tradition onto which the cultivation of summer rainfall cereal crops was grafted as it came into use south of the grassland areas on the Sahara’s southern borders
这种原始形式的 “蔬菜栽培”（根茎类作物的栽培）可能是一种经济传统，当夏季降雨谷物作物的栽培在撒哈拉南部边境的草原地区开始使用时，它被嫁接到这种传统上。

As the Sahara dried up after 5000 B
随着公元前5000年后撒哈拉沙漠的干涸 由于撒哈拉沙漠在公元前5000年后干涸了 由于撒哈拉沙漠在公元前5000年之后干涸了 由于撒哈拉沙漠在公元前5000年后干涸
C
C
, pastoral peoples (cattle herders) moved southward along major watercourses into the savanna belt of West Africa and the Sudan
牧民（牧牛人）沿着主要水道南下，进入西非和苏丹的热带草原地带。
By 3000 B
作者：3000 B 由3000 B 作者：3000B 按3000 B
C
C
, just as ancient Egyptian civilization was coming into being along the Nile, they had settled in the heart of the East African highlands far to the south
就在古埃及文明在尼罗河沿岸形成的时候，他们已经在远在南方的东非高原中心地带定居下来。
The East African highlands are ideal cattle country and the home today of such famous cattle-herding peoples as the Masai
东非高原是理想的养牛之乡，也是今天著名的养牛民族的家园，如马萨伊人。
The highlands were inhabited by hunter-gatherers living around mountains near the plains until about 3300 B
高原上居住着狩猎采集者，他们生活在平原附近的山地周围，直到大约公元前3300年。
C
C
, when the first cattle herders appeared
当第一批牧牛人出现时 当第一批牧民出现时 当第一批牧民出现的时候 当第一个牧民出现时
These cattle people may have moved between fixed settlements during the wet and dry seasons, living off hunting in the dry months and their own livestock and agriculture during the rains
这些牛人可能在雨季和旱季在固定的定居点之间移动，在旱季靠打猎为生，在雨季靠自己的牲畜和农业为生。

As was the case elsewhere, cattle were demanding animals in Africa
与其他地方的情况一样，牛在非洲也是要求很高的动物。
They required water at least every 24 hours and large tracts of grazing grass if herds of any size were to be maintained
如果要维持任何规模的畜群，它们至少每24小时都需要水和大片的牧草。
The secret was the careful selection of grazing land, especially in environments where seasonal rainfall led to marked differences in graze quality throughout the year
秘诀是仔细选择放牧地，特别是在季节性降雨导致全年放牧质量明显差异的环境中。
Even modest cattle herds required plenty of land and considerable mobility
即使是规模不大的牛群也需要大量的土地和相当的流动性
To acquire such land often required moving herds considerable distances, even from summer to winter pastures
为了获得这些土地，往往需要将牛群移到相当远的地方，甚至从夏季牧场移到冬季牧场。
At the same time, the cattle owners had to graze their stock in tsetse-fly-free areas The only protection against human and animal sleeping sickness, a disease carried by the tsetse fly, was to avoid settling or farming such areas - a constraint severely limiting the movements of cattle-owning farmers in eastern and central Africa
同时，牛的主人必须在没有采采蝇的地区放牧他们的牲畜。防止人类和动物昏睡病（一种由采采蝇携带的疾病）的唯一办法是避免在这些地区定居或耕作–这种限制严重地限制了非洲东部和中部拥有牛的农民的行动。
As a result, small cattle herds spread south rapidly in areas where they could be grazed
因此，小型牛群在可以放牧的地区迅速向南扩散
Long before cereal agriculture took hold far south of the Sahara, some hunter-gatherer groups in the savanna woodlands of eastern and southern Africa may have acquired cattle, and perhaps other domesticated animals, by gift exchange or through raids on herding neighbors
早在撒哈拉以南的谷物农业占据主导地位之前，非洲东部和南部草原林地的一些狩猎采集者群体可能已经通过礼物交换或袭击放牧的邻居获得了牛，或许还有其他驯化的动物。

Contrary to popular belief: there is no such phenomenon as “pure” pastoralists, a society that subsists on its herds alone
与流行的看法相反：不存在 “纯 “牧民这种现象，也不存在仅靠牧群生存的社会。
The Saharan herders who moved southward to escape drought were almost certainly also cultivating sorghum, millet; and other tropical rainfall crops
为躲避干旱而南迁的撒哈拉牧民几乎肯定也在种植高粱、小米和其他热带降雨作物。
By 1500 B
作者：1500 B 由1500 B 作者：1500B 按1500 B
C
C
, cereal agriculture was widespread throughout the savanna belt south of the Sahara
在撒哈拉以南的整个热带草原地带，谷物农业广泛存在。
Small farming communities dotted the grasslands and forest margins of eastern West Africa, all of them depending on what is called shifting agriculture
小型农业社区遍布西非东部的草原和森林边缘，所有这些社区都依赖于所谓的轮作农业
This form of agriculture involved clearing woodland, burning the felled brush over the cleared plot, mixing the ash into the soil, and then cultivating the prepared fields
这种农业形式包括清理林地，在清理过的地块上焚烧砍下的灌木，将灰烬混入土壤，然后耕种准备好的田地。
After a few years, the soil was exhausted, so the farmer moved on, exploiting new woodland and leaving the abandoned fields to lie fallow
几年后，土壤被耗尽，所以农民继续前进，开发新的林地，让废弃的田地休耕。
Shifting agriculture, often called slash-and-burn, was highly adaptive for savanna farmers without plows, for it allowed cereal farming with the minimal expenditure of energy
轮垦农业，通常被称为刀耕火种，对于没有犁的草原农民来说是非常适应的，因为它可以用最小的能量消耗来进行谷物耕种。

The process of clearance and burning may have seemed haphazard to the uninformed eye, but it was not
清理和焚烧的过程在不知情的人看来可能是杂乱无章的，但这并不是
Except in favored areas, such as regularly inundated floodplains: tropical Africa’s soils were of only moderate to low fertility
除了有利的地区，如经常被淹没的洪泛区：热带非洲的土壤只有中度至低度的肥力。
The art of farming was careful soil selection, that is, knowing which soils were light and easily cultivable, could be readily turned with small hoes, and would maintain their fertility over several years’ planting, for cereal crops rapidly remove nitrogen and other nutrients from the soil
耕作的艺术在于仔细选择土壤，也就是说，知道哪些土壤是轻质的、容易耕种的、可以用小锄头轻易翻动的，并能在几年的种植中保持其肥力，因为谷类作物会迅速从土壤中去除氮和其他营养物质。
Once it had taken hold: slash-and-burn agriculture expanded its frontiers rapidly as village after village took up new lands, moving forward so rapidly that one expert has estimated it took a mere two centuries to cover 2,000 kilometers from eastern to southern Africa
一旦它站稳了脚跟：刀耕火种的农业迅速扩大了它的疆域，一个又一个的村庄占据了新的土地，发展速度如此之快，以至于一位专家估计，从非洲东部到南部，仅用了两个世纪的时间就覆盖了2000公里的范围。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 河流沉积物
entry.content:
Stream Deposit
流动存款

A large, swift stream or river can carry all sizes of particles, from clay to boulders
湍急的大溪或河流可以携带各种大小的颗粒，从粘土到巨石。
When the current slows down, its competence (how much it can carry) decreases and the stream deposits the largest particles in the streambed
当水流速度减慢时，其能力（它能承载多少）就会减少，溪流就会在河床上沉积最大的颗粒。
If current velocity continues to decrease - as a flood wanes, for example - finer particles settle out on top of the large ones
如果流速继续下降–例如，随着洪水的减弱–更细的颗粒会在大颗粒之上沉淀下来。
Thus, a stream sorts its sediment according to size
因此，一条溪流根据大小对其沉积物进行分类 因此，溪流根据大小对其沉积物进行分类 因此，溪流按照大小对其沉积物进行分类 因此，溪流根据大小对其沉积物进行排序
A waning flood might deposit a layer of gravel, overlain by sand and finally topped by silt and clay
衰落的洪水可能会沉积一层砾石，上面是沙子，最后是淤泥和粘土。
Streams also sort sediment in the downstream direction
溪流也向下游方向分拣沉积物 溪流也在下游方向分拣沉积物 溪流也会在下游方向分拣沉积物 溪流也会在下游方向分拣泥沙
Many mountain streams are choked with boulders and cobbles, but far downstream, their deltas are composed mainly of fine silt and clay
许多山区溪流被巨石和卵石堵塞，但在遥远的下游，它们的三角洲主要由细小的淤泥和粘土组成。
This downstream sorting is curious because stream velocity generally increases in the downstream direction
这种下游分选很奇怪，因为流速通常在下游方向增加
Competence increases with velocity, so a river should be able to transport larger particles than its tributaries carry
能力随着速度的增加而增加，因此，一条河流应该能够运输比其支流所携带的更大的颗粒。
One explanation for downstream sorting is that abrasion wears away the boulders and cobbles to sand and silt as the sediment moves downstream over the years
对下游分选的一种解释是，随着沉积物长年累月地向下游移动，磨蚀将巨石和卵石磨成沙子和淤泥。
Thus, only the fine sediment reaches the lower parts of most rivers
因此，只有细小的沉积物到达大多数河流的下游部分。

A stream deposits its sediment in three environments: Alluvial fans and deltas form where stream gradient (angle of incline) suddenly decreases as a stream enters a flat plain, a lake, or the sea; floodplain deposits accumulate on a floodplain adjacent to the stream channel; and channel deposits form in the stream channel itself
溪流在三种环境中沉积其泥沙。冲积扇和三角洲是在溪流进入平坦的平原、湖泊或海洋时，溪流坡度（倾斜角度）突然减小的地方形成的；洪泛区沉积物在与溪流通道相邻的洪泛区积累；河道沉积物在溪流通道本身形成。
Bars, which are elongated mounds of sediment, are transient features that form in the stream channel and on the banks
栅栏是细长的沉积物堆，是在河道和岸边形成的短暂特征。
They commonly form in one year and erode the next
它们通常在一年内形成，并在第二年被侵蚀。 它们通常在一年中形成，并在第二年被侵蚀。 它们通常在一年内形成，并在第二年被腐蚀。 它们通常在一年内形成，第二年就会被侵蚀。
Rivers used for commercial navigation must be recharged frequently because bars shift from year to year
用于商业航行的河流必须经常补水，因为水位每年都在变化。
Imagine a winding stream
想象一下，一条蜿蜒的小溪 想象一下，一条蜿蜒的溪流 想象一下，一条蜿蜒的小河 想象一下一条蜿蜒的小溪
The water on the outside of the curve moves faster than the water on the inside
曲线外侧的水比内侧的水移动得快
The stream erodes its outside bank because the current’s inertia drives it into the outside bank
溪流侵蚀它的外岸，因为水流的惯性驱使它进入外岸。
At the same time, the slower water on the inside point of the bend deposits sediment, forming a point bar
同时，弯道内侧较慢的水流沉积了泥沙，形成了一个点状酒吧
A mid-channel bar is a sandy and gravelly deposit that forms in the middle of a stream channel
河道中段横杆是在河道中间形成的沙质和砾质沉积物。

Most streams flow in a single channel
大多数溪流以单一渠道流动 大多数溪流都在单一渠道中流动 大多数溪流都在单一的渠道中流动
In contrast, a braided stream flows in many shallow, interconnecting channels
与此相反，辫状河道在许多相互连接的浅水道中流动。
A braided stream forms where more sediment is supplied to a stream than it can carry
形成辫状溪流的原因是，向溪流提供的沉积物多于它所能承载的。
The stream dumps the excess sediment, forming mid-channel bars
溪流倾倒多余的沉积物，形成河道中间的条状物
The bars gradually fill a channel, forcing the stream to overflow its banks and erode new channels
条状物逐渐填满河道，迫使河流溢出河岸并侵蚀新的河道
As a result, a braided stream flows simultaneously in several channels and shifts back and forth across its floodplain
因此，辫状河道同时在几个河道中流动，并在其洪泛区来回移动
Braided streams are common in both deserts and glacial environments because both produce abundant sediment
辫状溪流在沙漠和冰川环境中都很常见，因为两者都会产生丰富的沉积物
A desert yields large amounts of sediment because it has little or no vegetation to prevent erosion
沙漠产生大量的沉积物，因为它很少或没有植被来防止侵蚀
Glaciers grind bedrock into fine sediment, which is carried by streams flowing from the melting ice
冰川将基岩磨成细小的沉积物，这些沉积物被从融化的冰面上流下的溪水带走。
If a steep mountain stream flows onto a flat plain, its gradient and velocity decrease sharply
如果一条陡峭的山脉流向平坦的平原，其坡度和速度会急剧下降
As a result, it deposits most of its sediment in a fan-shaped mound called an alluvial fan
因此，它的大部分沉积物沉积在一个扇形的小丘上，称为冲积扇。
Alluvial fans are common in many arid and semiarid mountainous regions
冲积扇在许多干旱和半干旱的山区很常见。

A stream also slows abruptly where it enters the still water of a lake or ocean
溪流在进入湖泊或海洋的静水时也会突然变慢。
The sediment settles out to form a nearly flat landform called a delta
沉积物沉淀下来，形成一个几乎平坦的地貌，称为三角洲
Part of the delta lies above water level, and the remainder lies slightly below water level
三角洲的一部分位于水位以上，其余部分略低于水位。
Deltas are commonly fan-shaped, resembling the Greek letter “delta” (∆)
三角洲通常呈扇形，类似于希腊字母 “delta”（∆）。
Both deltas and alluvial fans change rapidly
三角洲和冲积扇的变化都很迅速 三角洲和冲积扇的变化都很快 三角洲和冲积扇都在迅速变化 三角洲和冲积扇都在快速变化
Sediment fills channels (waterways), which are then abandoned while new channels develop as in a braided stream
沉积物填满渠道（水道），然后放弃，同时发展新的渠道，如辫子河中的渠道
As a result, a stream feeding a delta or fan splits into many channels called distributaries
因此，为三角洲或扇形地区提供水源的溪流会分裂成许多渠道，称为分水岭。
A large delta may spread out in this manner until it covers thousands of square kilometers
一个大的三角洲可能会以这种方式扩散，直到覆盖数千平方公里。
Most fans, however, are much smaller, covering a fraction of a square kilometer to a few square kilometers
然而，大多数风扇要小得多，覆盖面积从几分之一到几平方公里。
The Mississippi River has flowed through seven different delta channels during the past 5,000 to 6,000 years
密西西比河在过去5,000至6,000年中流经了七个不同的三角洲河道
But in recent years, engineers have built great systems of levees (retaining walls) in attempts to stabilize the channels
但近年来，工程师们建造了巨大的堤坝系统（挡土墙），试图稳定渠道。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 旧石器时代的洞穴壁画
entry.content:
Paleolithic Cave Paintings
旧石器时代的洞穴壁画

In any investigation of the origins of art, attention focuses on the cave paintings created in Europe during the Paleolithic era (c
在对艺术起源的任何调查中，人们的注意力都集中在旧石器时代在欧洲创造的洞穴壁画上（C
40,000-10,000 years ago) such as those depicting bulls and other animals in the Lascaux cave in France
40,000-10,000年前），如法国拉斯科洞穴中描绘公牛和其他动物的画像。
Accepting that they are the best preserved and most visible signs of what was a global creative explosion, how do we start to explain their appearance? Instinctively, we may want to update the earliest human artists by assuming that they painted for the sheer joy of painting
接受他们是当时全球创造性爆发的最好的保存和最明显的标志，我们如何开始解释他们的外观？本能地，我们可能想更新最早的人类艺术家，假设他们是为了纯粹的绘画乐趣而作画。
The philosophers of Classical Greece recognized it as a defining trait of humans to “delight in works of imitation”—to enjoy the very act and triumph of representation
古典希腊的哲学家们认为，”以模仿的作品为乐 “是人类的一个决定性特征–享受表现的行为和胜利。
If we were close to a real lion or snake, we might feel frightened
如果我们接近真正的狮子或蛇，我们可能会感到害怕
But a well- executed picture of a lion or snake will give us pleasure
但一幅表现良好的狮子或蛇的图片会给我们带来快乐
Why suppose that our Paleolithic ancestors were any different?
This simple acceptance of art for art’s sake has a certain appeal
为什么认为我们的旧石器时代的祖先有什么不同？ 这种为艺术而艺术的简单接受有一定的吸引力
To think of Lascaux as a gallery allows it to be a sort of special viewing place where the handiwork of accomplished artists might be displayed
将拉斯科视为一个画廊，使其成为一种特殊的观赏场所，有成就的艺术家的手工作品可能会在这里展出。
Plausibly, daily existence in parts of Paleolithic Europe may not have been so hard, with an abundance of ready food and therefore the leisure time for art
可以说，旧石器时代欧洲部分地区的日常生活可能并不那么艰苦，有大量的现成食物，因此有闲暇时间进行艺术创作。
The problems with this explanation, however, are various
然而，这种解释的问题是多方面的 但是，这种解释的问题是多方面的 然而，这种解释的问题有很多 然而，这种解释的问题是多种多样的
In the first place, the proliferation of archaeological discoveries—and this includes some of the world’s innumerable rock art sites that cannot be dated—has served to emphasize a remarkably limited repertoire of subjects
首先，考古发现的激增–这包括世界上一些无法确定年代的岩石艺术遗址–有助于强调一个非常有限的主题种类。
The images that recur are those of animals
反复出现的图像是那些动物的图像 重复出现的图像是那些动物的图像 反复出现的形象是那些动物的形象 反复出现的图像是那些动物的图像。
Human figures are unusual, and when they do make an appearance, they are rarely done with the same attention to form accorded to the animals
人类的形象是不寻常的，当他们出现时，他们很少以对动物的形式给予同样的关注来完成。
If Paleolithic artists were simply seeking to represent the beauty of the world around them, would they not have left a far greater range of pictures—of trees, flowers, of the Sun and the stars?
A further question to the theory of art for art’s sake is posed by the high incidence of Paleolithic images that appear not to be imitative of any reality whatsoever
如果旧石器时代的艺术家只是为了表现他们周围世界的美，他们难道不会留下更多的图片–树木、花朵、太阳和星星？ 对为艺术而艺术的理论提出的另一个问题是，旧石器时代的大量图像似乎不是对任何现实的模仿。
These are geometrical shapes or patterns consisting of dots or lines
这些是由点或线组成的几何形状或图案
Such marks may be found isolated or repeated over a particular surface but also scattered across more recognizable forms
这种标记可以在一个特定的表面上发现孤立的或重复的，但也可以散布在更多可识别的形式上。
A good example of this may be seen in the geologically spectacular grotto of Pêche Merle, in the Lot region of France
这方面的一个很好的例子是位于法国洛特地区的佩什-梅尔（Pêche Merle）地质学上的壮观石窟。
Here we encounter some favorite animals from the Paleolithic repertoire—a pair of stout-bellied horses
在这里，我们遇到了旧石器时代的一些喜爱的动物–一对粗壮的腹马
But over and around the horses’ outlines are multiple dark spots, daubed in disregard for the otherwise naturalistic representation of animals
但在马的轮廓上方和周围有多个黑点，这些黑点是无视动物的自然表现而涂抹的。
What does such patterning imitate? There is also the factor of location
这种模式化模仿的是什么？还有一个因素是地点
The caves of Lascaux might conceivably qualify as underground galleries, but many other paintings have been found in recesses totally unsuitable for any kind of viewing—tight nooks and crannies that must have been awkward even for the artists to penetrate, let alone for anyone else wanting to see the art
拉斯科洞穴可以说是地下画廊，但其他许多画作都是在完全不适合观看的凹处发现的–狭小的角落和缝隙，连艺术家都很难进入，更不用说其他想看艺术的人了。

Finally, we may doubt the notion that the Upper Paleolithic period was a paradise in which food came readily, leaving humans ample time to amuse themselves with art
最后，我们可能会怀疑旧石器时代上部是一个天堂，食物来的很容易，让人类有充足的时间用艺术来消遣
For Europe it was still the Ice Age
对欧洲来说，当时仍然是冰河时期 对欧洲来说，当时仍然是冰河时代 对欧洲来说，当时仍是冰河时代 对欧洲来说，当时仍是冰河时期
An estimate of the basic level of sustenance then necessary for human survival has been judged at 2200 calories per day
据估计，当时人类生存所需的基本营养水平为每天2200卡路里。
This consideration, combined with the stark emphasis upon animals in the cave art, has persuaded some archaeologists that the primary motive behind Paleolithic images must lie with the primary activity of Paleolithic people: hunting
这种考虑，再加上洞穴艺术中对动物的明显强调，使一些考古学家相信，旧石器时代图像背后的主要动机必须是旧石器时代人的主要活动：打猎

Hunting is a skill
狩猎是一种技能
Tracking, stalking, chasing, and killing the prey are difficult, sometimes dangerous activities
追踪、跟踪、追赶和杀死猎物是困难的，有时是危险的活动。
What if the process could be made easier—by art? In the early decades of the twentieth century, Abbé Henri Breuil argued that the cave paintings were all about “sympathetic magic
如果这个过程可以通过艺术变得更容易呢？在二十世纪初的几十年里，亨利-布雷尔神父（Abbé Henri Breuil）认为，洞穴壁画是关于 “同情的魔法”。
” The artists strived diligently to make their animal images evocative and realistic because they were attempting to capture the spirit of their prey
“ 艺术家们努力使他们的动物形象令人回味和逼真，因为他们试图捕捉猎物的精神。
What could have prompted their studious attention to making such naturalistic, recognizable images? According to Breuil, the artists may have believed that if a hunter were able to make a true likeness of some animal, then that animal was virtually trapped
是什么促使他们专注于制作这种自然的、可识别的图像？根据Breuil的说法，艺术家们可能认为，如果一个猎人能够做出某种动物的真实肖像，那么这种动物实际上就被困住了。
Images, therefore, may have had the magical capacity to confer success or luck in the hunt
因此，图像可能具有神奇的能力，可以在狩猎中获得成功或幸运。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 雨林的土壤
entry.content:
Rain Forest Soils
雨林的土壤

On viewing the lush plant growth of a tropical rain forest, most people would conclude that the soil beneath it is rich in nutrients
当看到热带雨林中茂盛的植物生长时，大多数人都会得出结论，它下面的土壤含有丰富的营养物质。
However, although rain forest soils are highly variable, they have in common the fact that abundant rainfall washes mineral nutrients out of them and into streams
然而，尽管热带雨林的土壤变化很大，但它们有一个共同的事实，即大量的降雨将矿物养分从土壤中冲出，进入溪流。
This process is known as leaching
这一过程被称为浸出 这个过程被称为浸出 这一过程被称为沥滤 这个过程被称为沥滤
Because of rain leaching, most tropical rain forest soils have low to very low mineral nutrient content, in dramatic contrast to mineral-rich grassland soils
由于雨水冲刷，大多数热带雨林土壤的矿物质养分含量较低或非常低，与矿物质丰富的草原土壤形成鲜明对比。
Tropical forest soils also often contain particular types of clays that, unlike the mineral-binding clays of temperate forest soils, do not bind mineral ions well
热带森林土壤还经常含有特殊类型的粘土，与温带森林土壤的矿物结合粘土不同，它们不能很好地结合矿物离子。
Aluminum is the dominant cation (positively charged ion) present in tropical soils; but plants do not require this element, and it is moderately toxic to a wide range of plants
铝是热带土壤中最主要的阳离子（带正电的离子）；但植物不需要这种元素，而且它对多种植物有中等毒性。
Aluminum also reduces the availability of phosphorus, an element in high demand by plants
铝还会减少磷的供应，而磷是植物高度需求的元素。

High moisture and temperatures speed the growth of soil microbes that decompose organic compounds, so tropical soils typically contain far lower amounts of organic materials (humus) than do other forest or grassland soils
高湿度和高温度加速了分解有机化合物的土壤微生物的生长，因此热带土壤中的有机物质（腐殖质）含量通常远远低于其他森林或草原土壤。
Because organic compounds help loosen compact clay soils, hold water, and bind mineral nutrients, the relative lack of organic materials in tropical soils is deleterious to plants
由于有机化合物有助于疏松紧实的粘土，保持水分，并结合矿物养分，所以热带土壤中相对缺乏的有机材料对植物是有害的。
Plant roots cannot penetrate far into hard clay soils, and during dry periods, the soil cannot hold enough water to supply plant needs
植物的根系不能深入到坚硬的粘土中，在干旱时期，土壤不能保持足够的水分来供应植物的需要。
Because the concentration of dark-colored organic materials is low in tropical soils, they are often colored red or yellow by the presence of iron, aluminum: and manganese oxides; when dry, these soils become rock hard
由于热带土壤中深色有机物的浓度很低，它们通常因铁、铝和锰氧化物的存在而被染成红色或黄色；干燥时，这些土壤变得坚硬如石。
The famous Cambodian temples of Angkor Wat, which have survived for many centuries, were constructed from blocks of such hard rain forest soils
保存了许多世纪的柬埔寨著名的吴哥窟寺庙，就是用这种坚硬的雨林土壤块建造的。

Given such poor soils, how can lush tropical forests exist? The answer is that the forest’s minerals are held in its living biomass—the trees and other plants and the animals
在如此贫瘠的土壤中，茂盛的热带森林如何存在？答案是，森林的矿物质存在于其生物质中–树木和其他植物以及动物。
In contrast to grasslands, where a large proportion of plant biomass is produced underground, that of tropical forests is nearly all aboveground
草原上的植物生物量有很大一部分是在地下产生的，而热带森林的生物量几乎都是在地上产生的。
Dead leaves, branches, and other plant parts, as well as the wastes and bodies of rain forest animals, barely reach the forest floor before they are rapidly decayed by abundant decomposers—bacterial and fungal
枯叶、树枝和其他植物部分，以及雨林动物的废物和尸体，在被丰富的分解者–细菌和真菌–迅速腐烂之前，几乎没有到达森林地面。
Minerals released by decay are quickly absorbed by multitudinous shallow, fine tree feeder roots and stored in plant tissues
腐烂所释放的矿物质迅速被众多的浅层细树根吸收，并储存在植物组织中。
Many tropical rain forest plants (like those in other forests) have mycorrhizal (fungus-root) partners whose delicate hyphae spread through great volumes of soil, from which they release and absorb minerals and ferry them back to the host plant in exchange for needed organic compounds
许多热带雨林植物（像其他森林中的植物一样）都有菌根（真菌-根）伙伴，其纤细的菌丝在大量的土壤中蔓延，它们从土壤中释放和吸收矿物质，并将它们运回宿主植物，以换取所需的有机化合物。
The fungal hyphae are able to absorb phosphorus that plant roots could not themselves obtain from the very dilute soil solutions, and fungal hyphae can transfer mineral nutrients from one forest plant to another
真菌菌丝能够吸收植物根系无法自己从非常稀薄的土壤溶液中获得的磷，而且真菌菌丝可以将矿物营养物质从一种森林植物转移到另一种森林植物中。
Consequently, tropical rain forests typically have what are known as closed nutrient systems, in which minerals are handed off from one organism to another with little leaking through to the soil
因此，热带雨林通常具有所谓的封闭式营养系统，其中矿物质从一个生物体转移到另一个生物体，很少渗漏到土壤中。
When mineral nutrients do not spend much time in the soil, they cannot be leached into streams
当矿物养分在土壤中停留的时间不长时，它们就不能被浸入溪流。
Closed nutrient systems have evolved in response to the leaching effects of heavy tropical rainfall
封闭式营养系统是为了应对热带强降雨的沥滤效应而演变的
Evidence for this conclusion is that nutrient systems are more open in the richest tropical soils and tightest in the poorest soils
这一结论的证据是，养分系统在最丰富的热带土壤中更为开放，而在最贫穷的土壤中最为紧密。

The growth of organisms is dependent on the availability of nutrients, none of which is more important than nitrogen
生物体的生长取决于营养物质的供应，其中最重要的莫过于氮。
Although there is an abundant supply of nitrogen in Earth’s atmosphere, it cannot be absorbed by plants unless it is “fixed,” or combined chemically with other elements to form nitrogen compounds
尽管地球大气中存在丰富的氮供应，但它不能被植物吸收，除非它被 “固定”，或与其他元素化学结合，形成氮化合物。
Nitrogen-fixing bacteria help tropical rain forest plants cope with the poor soils there by supplying them with needed nitrogen
固氮细菌通过为热带雨林植物提供所需的氮，帮助它们应对那里贫瘠的土壤
Many species of tropical rain forest trees belong to the legume family, which is known for associations of nitrogen-fixing bacteria within root nodules
许多热带雨林树种属于豆科植物，因根瘤内有固氮细菌而闻名。
Also, cycads (a type of tropical plant that resembles a palm tree) produce special aboveground roots that harbor nitrogen-fixing cyanobacteria
此外，苏铁（一种类似于棕榈树的热带植物）产生特殊的地上根系，孕育着固氮的蓝藻。
By growing above the ground, the roots are exposed to sunlight, which the cyanobacteria require for growth
通过在地面上生长，根部暴露在阳光下，而蓝细菌的生长需要阳光。
Nitrogen fixation by free-living bacteria in tropical soils is also beneficial
热带土壤中自由生活的细菌的固氮作用也是有益的

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 最早的文字证据
entry.content:
Evidence of the Earliest Writing
最早的文字证据

Although literacy appeared independently in several parts of the prehistoric world, the earliest evidence of writing is the cuneiform Sumerian script on the clay tablets of ancient Mesopotamia, which, archaeological detective work has revealed, had its origins in the accounting practices of commercial activity
尽管识字在史前世界的几个地方独立出现，但最早的文字证据是古代美索不达米亚的泥板上的楔形苏美尔文字，考古探测工作显示，这种文字起源于商业活动的会计惯例。
Researchers demonstrated that preliterate people, to keep track of the goods they produced and exchanged, created a system of accounting using clay tokens as symbolic representations of their products
研究人员证明，识字前的人们为了记录他们生产和交换的货物，创造了一种使用粘土代币作为其产品的象征性代表的会计系统。
Over many thousands of years, the symbols evolved through several stages of abstraction until they became wedge- shaped (cuneiform) signs on clay tablets, recognizable as writing
几千年来，这些符号经过几个阶段的抽象化演变，直到它们成为泥板上的楔形符号（楔形文字），可以被识别为文字。

The original tokens (circa 8500 B
原始代币（约公元前8500年 原始代币（大约公元前8500年 最初的代币（约公元前8500年 原始代币（约公元前8500年）。
C
C
E
E
) were three-dimensional solid shapes—tiny spheres, cones, disks, and cylinders
)是三维的固体形状–小球体、圆锥体、圆盘和圆柱体
A debt of six units of grain and eight head of livestock, for example might have been represented by six conical and eight cylindrical tokens
例如，6个单位的谷物和8头牲畜的债务可能由6个圆锥形和8个圆柱形令牌来表示
To keep batches of tokens together, an innovation was introduced (circa 3250 B
为了将成批的代币放在一起，人们引入了一项创新（约公元前3250年）。
C
C
E
E
) whereby they were sealed inside clay envelopes that could be broken open and counted when it came time for a debt to be repaid
)，据此，它们被封在粘土信封里，当需要偿还债务时，可以拆开信封进行计数。
But because the contents of the envelopes could easily be forgotten, two-dimensional representations of the three-dimensional tokens were impressed into the surface of the envelopes before they were sealed
但是，由于信封里的内容很容易被遗忘，所以在密封之前，在信封的表面印上了三维信物的二维表示。
Eventually, having two sets of equivalent symbols—the internal tokens and external markings—came to seem redundant, so the tokens were eliminated (circa 3250-3100 B
最后，有两套相当的符号–内部标记和外部标记–似乎是多余的，所以标记被取消了（约公元前3250-3100年）。
C
C
E
E
), and only solid clay tablets with two-dimensional symbols were retained
)，只保留了带有二维符号的固体泥板。
Over time, the symbols became more numerous, varied, and abstract and came to represent more than trade commodities, evolving eventually into cuneiform writing
随着时间的推移，这些符号变得越来越多，越来越多，越来越抽象，而且不仅仅代表贸易商品，最终演变为楔形文字。

The evolution of the symbolism is reflected in the archaeological record first of all by the increasing complexity of the tokens themselves
象征主义的演变首先反映在考古记录中，就是令牌本身的复杂性不断增加。
The earliest tokens, dating from about 10,000 to 6,000 years ago, were of only the simplest geometric shapes
最早的代币，可以追溯到大约10,000到6,000年前，只有最简单的几何形状。
But about 3500 B
但在公元前3500年左右 但大约在公元前3500年 但大约公元前3500年 但是，大约在公元前3500年
C
C
E
E
, more complex tokens came into common usage, including many naturalistic forms shaped like miniature tools, furniture, fruit, and humans
后来，更复杂的代币被普遍使用，包括许多自然主义的形式，形状像微型工具、家具、水果和人。
The earlier, plain tokens were counters for agricultural products, whereas the complex ones stood for finished products, such as bread, oil, perfume, wool, and rope, and for items produced in workshops, such as metal, bracelets, types of cloth, garments, mats, pieces of furniture, tools, and a variety of stone and pottery vessels
早期的普通代币是农产品的计数器，而复杂的代币则代表成品，如面包、油、香水、羊毛和绳子，以及工场生产的物品，如金属、手镯、各类布匹、服装、垫子、家具、工具和各种石器和陶器。
The signs marked on clay tablets likewise evolved from simple wedges, circles, ovals, and triangles based on the plain tokens to pictographs derived from the complex tokens
泥板上标记的符号也同样从简单的楔形、圆形、椭圆形和三角形发展到了从复杂符号衍生出来的象形文字。

Before this evidence came to light, the inventors of writing were assumed by researchers to have been an intellectual elite
在这一证据出现之前，研究人员认为文字的发明者是一个知识精英。
Some, for example, hypothesized that writing emerged when members of the priestly caste agreed among themselves on written signs
例如，有些人假设，当祭司种姓的成员之间就书面符号达成一致时，就出现了文字。
But the association of the plain tokens with the first farmers and of the complex tokens with the first artisans—and the fact that the token-and-envelope accounting system invariably represented only small-scale transactions—testifies to the relatively modest social status of the creators of writing
但是，将普通代币与第一批农民联系起来，将复杂的代币与第一批工匠联系起来，以及代币和信封会计系统始终只代表小规模的交易这一事实，证明了文字创造者相对温和的社会地位。

And not only of literacy, but numeracy (the representation of quantitative concepts) as well
而且不仅是识字，还有计算能力（数量概念的表述）。
The evidence of the tokens provides further confirmation that mathematics originated in people’s desire to keep records of flocks and other goods
代币的证据进一步证实，数学起源于人们记录羊群和其他物品的愿望。
Another immensely significant step occurred around 3100 B
另一个极为重要的步骤发生在公元前3100年左右
C
E
E
, when Sumerian accountants extended the token-based signs to include the first real numerals
当苏美尔人的会计人员将基于符号的标志扩展到包括第一个真实的数字时。
Previously, units of grain had been represented by direct one-to-one correspondence―by repeating the token or symbol for a unit of grain the required number of times
以前，粮食单位是通过一对一的直接对应来表示的–将一个粮食单位的标记或符号重复规定的次数。
The accountants, however, devised numeral signs distinct from commodity signs, so that eighteen units of grain could be indicated by preceding a single grain symbol with a symbol denoting “18
然而，会计人员设计了有别于商品符号的数字符号，因此，18个单位的谷物可以通过在一个谷物符号前加上一个表示 “18 “的符号来表示。
” Their invention of abstract numerals and abstract counting was one of the most revolutionary advances in the history of mathematics
“ 他们发明的抽象数字和抽象计数是数学史上最具革命性的进步之一。

What was the social status of the anonymous accountants who produced this breakthrough? The immense volume of clay tablets unearthed in the ruins of the Sumerian temples where the accounts were kept suggests a social differentiation within the scribal class, with a virtual army of lower-ranking tabulators performing the monotonous job of tallying commodities
产生这一突破的匿名会计人员的社会地位如何？在保存账目的苏美尔神庙废墟中出土的大量泥板表明，文士阶层内部存在着社会分化，实际上是由低级制表人组成的军队在进行单调的商品统计工作。
We can only speculate as to how high or low the inventors of true numerals were in the scribal hierarchy, but it stands to reason that this laborsaving innovation would have been the brainchild of the lower-ranking types whose drudgery is eased
我们只能猜测真数字的发明者在文士阶层中的地位有多高或多低，但有理由相信这一节省劳力的创新应该是低级别的人的创意，他们的苦差事被减轻了。

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 生命的元素
entry.content:
Elements of Life
生命的元素

The creation of life requires a set of chemical elements for making the components of cells
生命的创造需要一套化学元素来制造细胞的组成部分
Life on Earth uses about 25 of the 92 naturally occurring chemical elements, although just 4 of these elements—oxygen, carbon, hydrogen, and nitrogen—make up about 96 percent of the mass of living organisms
地球上的生命使用92种自然发生的化学元素中的大约25种，尽管这些元素中只有4种–氧、碳、氢和氮–构成了生物体质量的大约96%。
Thus, a first requirement for life might be the presence of most or all of the elements used by life
因此，生命的第一个要求可能是存在生命所使用的大部分或全部元素

Interestingly, this requirement can probably be met by almost any world
有趣的是，这个要求可能几乎可以被任何世界上的人所满足
Scientists have determined that all chemical elements in the universe besides hydrogen and helium (and a trace amount of lithium) were produced by stars
科学家们已经确定，宇宙中除了氢和氦（以及微量的锂）之外的所有化学元素都是由恒星产生的。
These are known as heavy elements because they are heavier than hydrogen and helium
这些元素被称为重元素，因为它们比氢和氦更重。
Although all of these heavy elements are quite rare compared to hydrogen and helium, they are found just about everywhere
尽管与氢和氦相比，所有这些重元素都相当罕见，但它们几乎随处可见。

Heavy elements are continually being manufactured by stars and released into space by stellar deaths, so their amount compared to hydrogen and helium gradually rises with time
重元素不断被恒星制造出来，并因恒星死亡而被释放到太空中，因此它们的数量与氢和氦相比，会随着时间的推移而逐渐上升。
Heavy elements make up about 2 percent of the chemical content (by mass) of our solar system, the other 98 percent is hydrogen and helium
重元素约占我们太阳系化学成分（按质量）的2%，其他98%是氢和氦。
In some very old star systems, which formed before many heavy elements were produced, the heavy-element share may be less than 0
在一些非常古老的恒星系统中，它们在许多重元素产生之前就已经形成了，重元素的比例可能低于0
1 percent
百分之1 1个百分点 1％的人 1％的
Nevertheless, every star system studied has at least some amount of all the elements used by life
然而，所研究的每一个恒星系统至少都有一定数量的生命所使用的所有元素。
Moreover, when planetesimals—small, solid objects formed in the early solar system that may accumulate to become planets—condense within a forming star system, they are inevitably made from heavy elements because the more common hydrogen and helium remain gaseous
此外，当小行星–早期太阳系中形成的、可能积累成行星的小型固体物体–在形成中的恒星系统中凝结时，它们不可避免地由重元素构成，因为更常见的氢和氦仍然是气态的。
Thus, planetesimals everywhere should contain the elements needed for life, which means that objects built from planetesimals—planets, moons, asteroids, and comets-also contain these elements
因此，各地的小行星应该含有生命所需的元素，这意味着由小行星建造的物体–行星、卫星、小行星和彗星–也含有这些元素。
The nature of solar-system formation explains why Earth contains all the elements needed for life, and it is why we expect these elements to be present on other worlds throughout our solar system, galaxy, and universe
太阳系形成的性质解释了为什么地球含有生命所需的所有元素，这也是为什么我们预计这些元素会出现在整个太阳系、银河系和宇宙的其他世界上的原因。

Note that this argument does not change, even if we allow for life very different from life on Earth
请注意，即使我们允许有与地球上的生命非常不同的生命，这个论点也不会改变。
Life on Earth is carbon based, and most biologists believe that life elsewhere is likely to be carbon based as well
地球上的生命是以碳为基础的，大多数生物学家认为，其他地方的生命也可能是以碳为基础的。
However, we cannot absolutely rule out the possibility of life with another chemical basis, such as silicon or nitrogen
然而，我们不能绝对排除有另一种化学基础的生命的可能性，如硅或氮。
The set of elements (or their relative proportions) used by life based on some other element might be somewhat different from that used by carbon-based life on Earth
基于其他元素的生命所使用的元素集（或其相对比例）可能与地球上基于碳的生命所使用的元素集有些不同
But the elements are still products of stars and would still be present in planetesimals everywhere
但这些元素仍然是恒星的产物，仍然会存在于各地的行星上。
No matter what kinds of life we are looking for, we are likely to find the necessary elements on almost every planet, moon, asteroid, and comet in the universe
无论我们在寻找什么样的生命，我们都有可能在宇宙中几乎每一颗行星、月球、小行星和彗星上找到必要的元素。

A somewhat stricter requirement is the presence of these elements in molecules that can be used as ready-made building blocks for life, just as early Earth probably had an organic soup of amino acids and other complex molecules
一个更严格的要求是这些元素在分子中的存在，可以作为生命的现成构件，就像早期地球可能有氨基酸和其他复杂分子的有机汤。
Earth’s organic molecules likely came from some combination of three sources: chemical reactions in the atmosphere, chemical reactions near deep-sea vents in the oceans, and molecules carried to Earth by asteroids and comets
地球上的有机分子可能来自三个来源的某种组合：大气中的化学反应，海洋中深海喷口附近的化学反应，以及由小行星和彗星带到地球的分子。
The first two sources can occur only on worlds with atmospheres or oceans, respectively
前两个来源只可能发生在有大气层或海洋的世界上，分别为
But the third source should have brought similar molecules to nearly all worlds in our solar system
但第三个来源应该给我们太阳系的几乎所有世界带来了类似的分子

Studies of meteorites and comets suggest that organic molecules are widespread among both asteroids and comets
对陨石和彗星的研究表明，有机分子在小行星和彗星中都很普遍
Because each body in the solar system was repeatedly struck by asteroids and comets during the period known as the heavy bombardment (about 4 billion years ago), each body should have received at least some organic molecules
由于太阳系中的每个天体在被称为重度轰击的时期（大约40亿年前）被小行星和彗星反复撞击，每个天体都应该至少收到一些有机分子。
However, these molecules tend to be destroyed by solar radiation on surfaces unprotected by atmospheres
然而，在没有大气层保护的表面上，这些分子往往被太阳辐射所破坏
Moreover, while these molecules might stay intact beneath the surface (as they evidently do on asteroids and comets), they probably cannot react with each other unless some kind of liquid or gas is available to move them about
此外，虽然这些分子可能在地表下保持完整（正如它们在小行星和彗星上显然所做的那样），但除非有某种液体或气体可供它们移动，否则它们可能无法相互反应。
Thus, if we limit our search to worlds on which organic molecules are likely to be involved in chemical reactions, we can probably rule out any world that lacks both an atmosphere and a surface or subsurface liquid medium, such as water
因此，如果我们把搜索范围限制在有机分子可能参与化学反应的世界上，我们也许可以排除任何既没有大气层又没有表面或地下液体介质的世界，如水

  • 由deepl提供翻译

entry.title: 北美巨型动物的过度杀戮
entry.content:
Overkill of the North American Megafauna
北美巨型动物的过度杀戮

Thousands of years ago, in North America’s past, all of its megafauna—large mammals such as mammoths and giant bears—disappeared
几千年前，在北美的过去，所有的巨型动物–大型哺乳动物，如猛犸象和巨熊–都消失了。
One proposed explanation for this event is that when the first Americans migrated over from Asia, they hunted the megafauna to extinction
对这一事件提出的一个解释是，当第一批美国人从亚洲迁移过来时，他们将巨型动物猎杀到灭绝。
These people, known as the Clovis society after a site where their distinctive spear points were first found, would have been able to use this food source to expand their population and fill the continent rapidly
这些人因其独特的矛头首次被发现而被称为克洛维斯社会，他们能够利用这一食物来源扩大人口并迅速填满大陆。
Yet many scientists argue against this “Pleistocene overkill” hypothesis
然而，许多科学家反对这种 “更新世过度杀戮 “的假说
Modern humans have certainly been capable of such drastic effects on animals, but could ancient people with little more than stone spears similarly have caused the extinction of numerous species of animals?Thirty-five genera or groups of species (and many individual species) suffered extinction in North America around 11,000 B
现代人当然有能力对动物产生如此剧烈的影响，但除了石矛之外没有什么别的东西的古代人是否也能同样造成众多动物物种的灭绝？
C
C
, soon after the appearance and expansion of Paleo-lndians throughout the Americas (27 genera disappeared completely, and another 8 became locally extinct, surviving only outside North America)
在古印第安人出现并扩展到整个美洲后不久（27个属完全消失，另外8个属局部灭绝，只在北美以外地区生存）。

Although the climate changed at the end of the Pleistocene, warming trends had happened before
虽然气候在更新世末期发生了变化，但变暖趋势在之前就已经发生了
A period of massive extinction of large mammals like that seen about 11,000 years ago had not occurred during the previous 400,000 years, despite these changes
尽管发生了这些变化，像大约1.1万年前那样的大型哺乳动物大规模灭绝的时期在之前的40万年里并没有发生。
The only apparently significant difference in the Americas 11,000 years ago was the presence of human hunters of these large mammals
1.1万年前的美洲唯一明显的区别是出现了人类对这些大型哺乳动物的狩猎者
Was this coincidence or cause-and-effect?
We do not know
这到底是巧合还是因果关系？ 我们不知道
Ecologist Paul S
生态学家Paul S
Martin has championed the model that associates the extinction of large mammals at the end of the Pleistocene with human predation
马丁倡导将更新世末期大型哺乳动物的灭绝与人类捕食联系起来的模式。
With researcher J
与研究人员

Mosimann, he has co-authored a work in which a computer model showed that in around 300 years, given the right conditions, a small influx of hunters into eastern Beringia 12,000 years ago could have spread across North America in a wave and wiped out game animals to feed their burgeoning population
莫西曼，他与人合著了一项工作，其中一个计算机模型显示，在大约300年内，如果有合适的条件，12000年前涌入白令谷东部的少量猎人可能会一浪高过一浪地传遍北美，并消灭猎物以养活其急剧增长的人口

The researchers ran the model several ways, always beginning with a population of 100 humans in Edmonton, in Alberta, Canada, at 11,500 years ago
研究人员以多种方式运行该模型，总是从加拿大阿尔伯塔省埃德蒙顿的100个人类人口开始，时间为11500年前
Assuming different initial North American big-game-animal populations (75-150 million animals) and different population growth rates for the human settlers (0
假设北美大型动物的初始数量不同（7,500-1,000万只），人类定居者的人口增长率不同（0
65%-3
65%-3
5%), and varying kill rates, Mosimann and Martin derived figures of between 279 and 1,157 years from initial contact to big-game extinction
5%），以及不同的捕杀率，Mosimann和Martin得出的数字是：从最初接触到大型动物灭绝的时间为279至1157年。

Many scholars continue to support this scenario
许多学者继续支持这一设想 许多学者继续支持这种情况 许多学者继续支持这种设想 许多学者继续支持这种情况的发生
